thread.title: Joan Collins says Tara Palmer-Tomkinson's death left Prince Charles 'devastated'
thread.title_full: Joan Collins says Tara Palmer-Tomkinson's death left Prince Charles 'devastated'

author: Alistair McGeorge
title: Joan Collins says Tara Palmer-Tomkinson's death left Prince Charles 'devastated'
text:
Joan Collins, Tara Palmer Tomkinson, Prince Charles (Photo: Getty Images/Rex features) Share Get celebs   Thank you for subscribing! Could   
Dame Joan Collins has revealed that Tara Palmer-Tomkinson's godfather Prince Charles was absolutely "devastated" over the star's tragic death. 
The beloved socialite died of a perforated ulcer on February 8 aged 45, and her friend has told of how upset the British royal looked when she saw him after the sad news. 
"It was terrible, terrible news," Dame Joan told The Sun . "A lot of people were broken up. Prince Charles, too. Shortly afterwards, I went to a thing for The Prince’s Trust and said to him, ‘I’m so sorry, Sir, about your friend Tara’. Tara Palmer-Tomkinson and Prince Charles (Photo: AFP) 
"And he looked very sad. She was his godchild." Read More Tara Palmer-Tomkinson's poignant final song reassures loved ones she's a cloud "looking down" on them 
At the time, The Prince of Wales said he was "deeply saddened" by the death of his goddaughter. 
In joint statement issued by Clarence House, Charles and the Duchess of Cambridge added: "Our thoughts are so much with the family." Joan has opened up about Tara's passing (Photo: Getty) 
Meanwhile, Dame Joan also revealed how Tara was excited for a career resurgence months before her death after taking time out of the spotlight. 
Dame Joan explained that the star came to her book launch last year, and was "full of life" and looking forward to new projects. 
"She said, 'I've been off the radar because I haven’t been well. I’m happy now I’m back’. It’s very sad. She was quite young," she added. Like us on Facebook
